alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 6:57PM EDT until August 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall associated with Tropical Idalia moving across Dorchester and Berkeley Counties. As much as 2 to 5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Moncks Corner, Saint George, Givhans Ferry State Park, Dorchester, Ridgeville, Harleyville, Reevesville, Jedburg, Givhans, Cross, Eastern Lake Marion, Southern Lake Moultrie, Pinopolis, Eadytown, Old Santee Canal State Park, Pringletown, Spring Hill, Francis Beidler Forest and Sandridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
